message: We could not find what you asked for, but got you this
subject: english

data.question: Aliya although is born with a silver spoon, but she has no freedom to move around meet new people unlike other persons. This signals to the…
data.section: Questions are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"
data.solution: Aliya at age 12 envy of the girls hawking on the street and their freedom to move about as compared to her restriction to move about, eventhough she born into a comfortable home, significantly indicates the irony of life i.e no one has it all.

data.question: The athlete has unexpectedly become <u>indomitable</u>?
data.section: In each of questions 86 to 100, choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

data.question: The guard spent all the night pacing _____.
data.section: Choose the option that best complete the gap.
data.solution:
To and fro as is both a noun, verb and an adverb. It means a constant movement backwards and forwards or from side to side. constant movement backwards and forwards. Example "she cradled him, rocking him to and fro"

synonyms: from place to place · around · about · to and fro · hither and thither ·

data.section: For these questions, choose the most appropriate stress pattern from the options. The Stressed syllable are written in capital letter (s)
data.solution: In nouns ending -isation or -ization, we stress the /eɪ/:

data.question: Many people believed that such an action is <u>unbecoming</u> of a leader
data.section: choose the most appropriate option nearest in meaning to the word(s) underlined.
data.solution: Unbecoming: (of behaviour) not fitting or appropriate; unseemly.

data.question:
From the options, choose the word(s) that best filll the gap.

data.solution: The answer is ‘D’ because it is its present perfect continuous tense

data.question: The police found a conclusive proof of the boy's guilt

data.question: Although Chide's manners are quite <u>refined</u> , his colleagues are rather ___________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Refined implies to purify or to be free from impurities. Option B; crude, is a direct opposite to the word 'refine'' which means being in a natural state.

data.question: 1 owe you far less than you owe me

option.a: My debt to you is greater than yours to me
option.b: Your debt is not much greater than mine
option.c: What we owe each other Is approximately the same
option.d: I owe you something, but you owe me much more

data.section: the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

data.question:
From the options given, Choose the option that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.

This house which was <u>sealed</u> off years ago has now been —
data.solution: Sealed off means to prevent people from entering a building

data.question: Rather than make <u>derogatory<u/> remarks about the host, a guest should make ________ ones
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Derogatory implies 'to lessen one's value'. However, complimentary is an expression of praise.

data.question: QUALITY?
data.section: In each of the questions 33 to 36 Select the word that has the same pattern of stress as the given word.
data.solution:
Quality is stressed on the first syllable /ˈkwɒlɪti/

A. guarantee  is stressed on the third syllable /ɡar(ə)nˈtiː/

B. accepted  is stressed on the second syllable /əkˈsɛptid/

C. bachelor  is stressed on the first syllable /ˈbatʃələ/

D. related  is stressed on the second syllable /rɪˈleɪt/

data.question: shea<u>th </u>
data.section: choose the option that has the same consonant sound as the one represented by the letter(s) underlined

data.question: This class __________students and teachers
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
Comprise means 'made up of'. Therefore, to say 'Comprises of/ Comprise of ' is a tautology.

Note that, singular verbs must agree with a singular noun.

The subject of the sentence is 'This Class' which is a singular noun

This makes Option B correct.

data.question: Otokpa is a member of the <u>ad hoc</u>committee on stock acquisition.
data.section: In each of the questions 36 to 50 choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word or phrase.
data.solution:
Ad hoc; when necessary or needed. something that has been formed or used for a special and immediate purpose, without previous planning. 

Formal; done in accordance with convention or etiquette; suitable for or constituting an official or important occasion
